Pre-Game Insights: Colombia have progressed to the knockout rounds for the sixth successive Copa America tournament, finishing top of Group D with seven points from three matches.
Panama have qualified for the knockout rounds for the first time in their history this year after picking up six points to finish second in Group C.
Colombia have won their last two meetings with Panama by an aggregate score of 7-0, with their last encounter in June 2019 resulting in a 3-0 win.

Panama head into the match in high spirits, having won 10 of their last 15 international matches and climbing 38 places in the FIFA World Rankings since their appointment of Thomas Christiansen in 2020.
Colombia's Nestor Lorenzo has an impressive unbeaten record as manager, winning 17 and drawing six of his 23 matches in all competitions since taking the reins in July 2022.
Colombia's predicted starting lineup includes Mateus Uribe, Richard Rios, and Jhon Arias in midfield, while Panama's starting lineup features Jovani Welch in centre-midfield.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is a quarter-final in the Copa America, with the winners to face either Uruguay or Brazil in the semi-finals.
Colombia are ranked 12th in the world by FIFA and have reached the Copa America semi-finals in two of the last three tournaments.
Panama's victory over the USA and Bolivia in the group stage secured their first knockout appearance in Copa America history.
